title: Minutes of Tainan City Government’s 438th Municipal Administrative Meeting Mayor’s remarks 5/12/2020
content: Mayor’s Remarks:1. As requested by the central government and the National Development Council, all bureaus should accelerate the process of bidding and announce relevant details online. When the pandemic is over, subsidies form the central government will be proceeded. If any difficulties appear, Deputy Mayor Wang should assist with the coordination, and the Finance and Local Tax Bureau should rearrange budget allocation.2. As Taiwan marks 30 days of no local cases, we are entering the post-pandemic period. Bureaus and District Offices should start discussing resuming activities planned for the second half of the year.3. Although the alert level of water shortage was raised to yellow, the plum rain season is about to start. In addition, according to the forecast of the Central Weather Bureau, rainfall this year should be normal. If everything goes well, the water shortage situation should be alleviated soon. While bureaus are preparing for droughts, flooding prevention works should not be ignored. The Water Resources Bureau and concerned departments should pay extra attention. Also, the Bureau of Civil Affairs and the Environmental Protection Bureau should join forces with District Offices and civil society to start desilting work and clearing mosquito breeding grounds in advance.
